DOC.brief_summary: Research show high level vitamin D deficiency pregnant woman Northern Ireland . Body composition determinant vitamin D status . Vitamin D fat soluble vitamin therefore may hide within adipose/fat tissue overweight/obese individual . All pregnant breastfeed woman advise take daily supplement contain 10μg vitamin D. The investigator hypothesise overweight/ obese pregnant woman low vitamin D status leaner counterpart start pregnancy may need high daily supplementation achieve sufficient status . The investigator propose randomise supplementation study pregnant woman ( n 240 ) Western Health Social Care Trust Area invite take part . Inclusion criterion : pregnant woman first trimester , without current pregnancy related complication , singleton pregnancy , age ≥18 year , Body Mass Index ( BMI ) > 18.5kg /m² . Participants randomise receive either 0μg ( placebo ) plus multivitamin 10μg vitamin D plus multivitamin 12 week gestation delivery . The multivitamin already contain 10μg vitamin D; Therefore participant randomise receive total 10μg 20μg vitamin D. Blood sample ( 20mls ) take 12 , 28 36 week gestation . A sample blood take cord delivery . Vitamin D status main outcome measurement . All blood sample analyse vitamin D associate metabolite . Data collect health lifestyle , supplementation use food intake . Body composition measurement record appointment infant anthropometric measurement take maternal note delivery . Findings research use inform nutrition policy appropriate vitamin D supplementation level pregnancy may dependent upon pre pregnancy BMI .
DOC.brief_title: Impact Maternal Body Weight Vitamin D Status During Pregnancy
DOC.criteria: Pregnant woman Age ≥18years BMI > 18.5 kg/m² Without current pregnancy related complication At least 12 week gestation Have singleton pregnancy ( confirm first scan ) Pregnant woman currently take vitamin D sun holiday include study . All participant agree discontinue current supplementation provide multivitamin duration pregnancy . Aged < 18 year Pregnancy BMI < 18.5kg/m² Participants multiple pregnancy Participants currently involve another research study Participants history gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , vascular haematological disorder . Participants vitro fertilisation ( IVF ) treatment Participants history NTD affect pregnancy Pregnant woman active thyroid disease ( e.g. , Graves , Hashimoto thyroiditis ) Planned home birth
